cluster_relations.rel_desc: Social and political change is said to occur within societies.
The Arab Spring took place in the Middle East.
Public protest demonstrations and the movements they inspire occur around the world.
remarks: Relation captures global spread of protest-inspired movements.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an event, process, or phenomenon takes place within a specified spatial or societal context.
args.justification: All three relations describe where an event or sociopolitical process takes place (within societies, in the Middle East, around the world). They share the same spatial occurrence semantics and can be normalized under a single predicate 'occurs_in'.
Each relation links an event or ongoing sociopolitical process to the spatial or societal context where it unfolds, fitting a common class for event/process-to-location connections.
The core semantic dimension is spatial: each predicate specifies the place or spatial/societal context in which events or processes occur.
